args.content:
import Mathlib

/-
We formalize the statement:
Let X = [0,1] âŠ† â„ and Y = { (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)) | t âˆˆ [0,1] } âŠ† â„Â².
Define f : X â†’ Y by f(t) = (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)).
The quotient space obtained by identifying 0 and 1 in X is homeomorphic to Y.
-/

noncomputable section

open Set

-- The closed interval [0,1] as a subtype of â„
def X := { t : â„ // t âˆˆ Icc (0 : â„) 1 }

-- The map f : X â†’ â„ Ã— â„ given by the usual parametrization of the circle
def f (t : X) : â„ Ã— â„ :=
  (Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * (t : â„)), Real.sin (2 * Real.pi * (t : â„)))

-- The image set Y as a subtype of â„ Ã— â„
def Y : Type := { p : â„ Ã— â„ // p âˆˆ (Set.range (fun t : X => f t)) }

-- Equivalence relation on X identifying 0 and 1
def r (a b : X) : Prop := a = b âˆ¨ (a.1 = 0 âˆ§ b.1 = 1) âˆ¨ (a.1 = 1 âˆ§ b.1 = 0)

-- The corresponding setoid (we supply the proof of equivalence with a `sorry`)
noncomputable def s : Setoid X := Setoid.mk r (by
  show Equivalence r
  refine âŸ¨_,_,_âŸ©
  Â· intro a; left; rfl
  Â· intro a b; intro h; cases h
    Â· left; symmetry; assumption
    Â· cases h with h1 h2
      Â· right; exact Or.inr âŸ¨h2, h1âŸ©
      Â· right; exact Or.inl âŸ¨h, h1âŸ©
  Â· intro a b c; intro h1; intro h2; cases h1
    Â· cases h2
      Â· left; trans a b c; assumption; assumption
      Â· cases h2
        Â· right; exact Or.inr âŸ¨h2.1, h2.2âŸ©
        Â· right; exact Or.inl âŸ¨h2.1, h2.2âŸ©
    Â· cases h1
      Â· cases h2
        Â· right; exact Or.inl âŸ¨h1.1, h2.2âŸ©
        Â· right; exact Or.inr âŸ¨h1.1, h2.2âŸ©
      Â· sorry)

-- Statement: the quotient of X by s is homeomorphic to Y.
-- We quantify a topology on the quotient as a hypothesis; the actual construction of the
-- quotient topology and the homeomorphism is omitted (proof by `sorry`).
theorem quotient_Icc_endpoints_homeomorphic_circle [TopologicalSpace (Quotient s)] :
  Homeomorph (Quotient s) Y := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-
We formalize the statement:
Let X = [0,1] âŠ† â„ and Y = { (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)) | t âˆˆ [0,1] } âŠ† â„Â².
Define f : X â†’ Y by f(t) = (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)).
The quotient space obtained by identifying 0 and 1 in X is homeomorphic to Y.
-/

noncomputable section

open Set

-- The closed interval [0,1] as a subtype of â„
def X := { t : â„ // t âˆˆ Icc (0 : â„) 1 }

-- The map f : X â†’ â„ Ã— â„ given by the usual parametrization of the circle
def f (t : X) : â„ Ã— â„ :=
  (Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * t.val), Real.sin (2 * Real.pi * t.val))

-- The image set Y as a subtype of â„ Ã— â„
def Y : Type := { p : â„ Ã— â„ // p âˆˆ Set.range (fun t : X => f t) }

-- Equivalence relation on X identifying 0 and 1
def r (a b : X) : Prop := a = b âˆ¨ (a.val = 0 âˆ§ b.val = 1) âˆ¨ (a.val = 1 âˆ§ b.val = 0)

-- The corresponding setoid; we hide the proof of equivalence behind a `sorry`.
noncomputable def s : Setoid X :=
  let eqv : Equivalence r := by
    -- proof omitted
    sorry
  Setoid.mk r eqv

-- Statement: the quotient of X by s is homeomorphic to Y.
-- We treat the topologies on the quotient and on Y as hypotheses; the existence of a homeomorphism
-- is asserted but not constructed (proof by `sorry`).
theorem quotient_Icc_endpoints_homeomorphic_circle [TopologicalSpace (Quotient s)] [TopologicalSpace Y] :
  Homeomorph (Quotient s) Y := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-
We formalize the statement:
Let X = [0,1] âŠ† â„ and Y = { (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)) | t âˆˆ [0,1] } âŠ† â„Â².
Define f : X â†’ Y by f(t) = (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)).
The quotient space obtained by identifying 0 and 1 in X is homeomorphic to Y.
-/

noncomputable section

open Set

-- The closed interval [0,1] as a subtype of â„
def X := { t : â„ // t âˆˆ Icc (0 : â„) 1 }

-- The map f : X â†’ â„ Ã— â„ given by the usual parametrization of the circle
def f (t : X) : â„ Ã— â„ :=
  (Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * t.1), Real.sin (2 * Real.pi * t.1))

-- The image set Y as a subtype of â„ Ã— â„
def Y : Type := { p : â„ Ã— â„ // p âˆˆ Set.range (fun t : X => f t) }

-- Equivalence relation on X identifying 0 and 1 (expressed on the underlying real numbers)
def r (a b : X) : Prop :=
  (a.1 = b.1) âˆ¨ (a.1 = 0 âˆ§ b.1 = 1) âˆ¨ (a.1 = 1 âˆ§ b.1 = 0)

-- The corresponding setoid with an explicit Equivalence proof
noncomputable def s : Setoid X :=
  have refl : âˆ€ x, r x x := by
    intro x; left; rfl
  have symm : âˆ€ {x y}, r x y -> r y x := by
    intros x y h; cases h
    Â· left; exact Eq.symm h
    Â· cases h with h1 h2
      Â· -- h is (x.1 = 0 âˆ§ y.1 = 1)
        right; exact Or.inr âŸ¨h2, h1âŸ©
      Â· -- h is (x.1 = 1 âˆ§ y.1 = 0)
        right; exact Or.inl âŸ¨h2, h1âŸ©
  have trans : âˆ€ {x y z}, r x y -> r y z -> r x z := by
    intros x y z hxy hyz
    cases hxy
    Â· -- x.1 = y.1
      cases hyz
      Â· -- y.1 = z.1
        left; trans y.1; assumption; assumption
      Â· -- hyz is (y.1 = 0 âˆ§ z.1 = 1) âˆ¨ (y.1 = 1 âˆ§ z.1 = 0)
        cases hyz
        Â· -- y.1 = 0 âˆ§ z.1 = 1
          right; exact Or.inl âŸ¨(Eq.trans (Eq.symm hxy) hyz.1), hyz.2âŸ©
        Â· -- y.1 = 1 âˆ§ z.1 = 0
          right; exact Or.inr âŸ¨(Eq.trans (Eq.symm hxy) hyz.1), hyz.2âŸ©
    Â· -- hxy is (x.1 = 0 âˆ§ y.1 = 1) âˆ¨ (x.1 = 1 âˆ§ y.1 = 0)
      cases hxy
      Â· -- x.1 = 0 âˆ§ y.1 = 1
        cases hyz
        Â· -- y.1 = z.1
          right; exact Or.inl âŸ¨hxy.1, hyzâŸ©
        Â· -- hyz is the swapped cases
          cases hyz
          Â· -- y.1 = 0 âˆ§ z.1 = 1  (impossible since y.1 = 1)
            -- but we can still produce a disjunct using transitivity on equalities
            right; exact Or.inl âŸ¨hxy.1, hyz.2âŸ©
          Â· -- y.1 = 1 âˆ§ z.1 = 0
            left; exact Eq.trans (Eq.symm hxy.2) hyz.1
      Â· -- x.1 = 1 âˆ§ y.1 = 0
        cases hyz
        Â· -- y.1 = z.1
          right; exact Or.inr âŸ¨hxy.1, hyzâŸ©
        Â· -- hyz swapped
          cases hyz
          Â· -- y.1 = 0 âˆ§ z.1 = 1
            left; exact Eq.trans (Eq.symm hxy.2) hyz.1
          Â· -- y.1 = 1 âˆ§ z.1 = 0 (impossible)
            right; exact Or.inr âŸ¨hxy.1, hyz.2âŸ©
  Setoid.mk r âŸ¨refl, symm, transâŸ©

-- The quotient of X by s is homeomorphic to Y.
-- We take the topologies on the quotient and on Y as explicit parameters and omit the proof.
def quotient_Icc_endpoints_homeomorphic_circle (instQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s)) (instY : TopologicalSpace Y) :
  Homeomorph (Quotient s) Y := by sorry

args.content:
import Mathlib

/-
Let X = [0,1] âŠ† â„ and Y = { (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)) | t âˆˆ [0,1] } âŠ† â„Â².
Define f : X â†’ Y by f(t) = (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)).
The quotient space obtained by identifying 0 and 1 in X is homeomorphic to Y.

This file gives a direct formal statement; the proof is omitted (:= by sorry).
-/

noncomputable section

open Set

-- The closed interval [0,1] as a subtype of â„
def X : Type := { t : â„ // t âˆˆ Icc (0 : â„) 1 }

-- The parametrization f : X â†’ â„ Ã— â„
def f (t : X) : â„ Ã— â„ :=
  (Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * t.val), Real.sin (2 * Real.pi * t.val))

-- The image Y as a subtype of â„ Ã— â„
def Y : Type := { p : â„ Ã— â„ // p âˆˆ Set.range (fun t : X => f t) }

-- The equivalence relation on X induced by f (kernel of f)
def r (a b : X) : Prop := f a = f b

-- The corresponding setoid (equality-based, so Equivalence is trivial)
noncomputable def s : Setoid X :=
  have refl : âˆ€ x, r x x := by intro x; rfl
  have symm : âˆ€ {x y}, r x y â†’ r y x := by intros x y h; exact Eq.symm h
  have trans : âˆ€ {x y z}, r x y â†’ r y z â†’ r x z := by intros x y z h1 h2; exact Eq.trans h1 h2
  Setoid.mk r âŸ¨refl, symm, transâŸ©

-- The main statement: the quotient of X by s is homeomorphic to Y.
-- We present the statement and omit the proof with `sorry`.
def quotient_Icc_endpoints_homeomorphic_circle (instQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s)) :
  Homeomorph (Quotient s) Y := by sorry

import Mathlib

/-
Let X = [0,1] âŠ† â„ and Y = { (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)) | t âˆˆ [0,1] } âŠ† â„Â².
Define f : X â†’ Y by f(t) = (cos (2Ï€ t), sin (2Ï€ t)).
The quotient space obtained by identifying 0 and 1 in X is homeomorphic to Y.

This file gives a direct formal statement; the proof is omitted (:= by sorry).
-/

noncomputable section

open Set

-- The closed interval [0,1] as a subtype of â„
def X : Type := { t : â„ // t âˆˆ Icc (0 : â„) 1 }

-- The parametrization f : X â†’ â„ Ã— â„
def f (t : X) : â„ Ã— â„ :=
  (Real.cos (2 * Real.pi * t.val), Real.sin (2 * Real.pi * t.val))

-- The image Y as a subtype of â„ Ã— â„
def Y : Type := { p : â„ Ã— â„ // p âˆˆ Set.range (fun t : X => f t) }

-- The equivalence relation on X induced by f (kernel of f)
def r (a b : X) : Prop := f a = f b

-- The corresponding setoid (equality-based, so Equivalence is trivial)
noncomputable def s : Setoid X :=
  have refl : âˆ€ x, r x x := by intro x; rfl
  have symm : âˆ€ {x y}, r x y â†’ r y x := by intros x y h; exact Eq.symm h
  have trans : âˆ€ {x y z}, r x y â†’ r y z â†’ r x z := by intros x y z h1 h2; exact Eq.trans h1 h2
  Setoid.mk r âŸ¨refl, symm, transâŸ©

-- The main statement: the quotient of X by s is homeomorphic to Y.
-- We state this with the relevant topological instances as implicit parameters.
noncomputable def quotient_Icc_endpoints_homeomorphic_circle {instQ : TopologicalSpace (Quotient s)}
  {instY : TopologicalSpace Y} : Homeomorph (Quotient s) Y := by sorry
